result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua V Werchowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Joshua V Werchowski

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($243) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge is waived.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Attend Victim Impact Panel on 06-17-2015.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

supervisions.notes: Any outstanding court costs are to be paid in full by 01-08-2016 or serve 5 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.

Straight Time.
Apply 68 days sentence credit.
TIME SERVED.

records.addlTxt:
Revoked - sentenced to time served
Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joshua V Werchowski in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.   

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
68 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
68 Days Credit.
Time Served.

Any outstanding cost/fines are to be paid in full by:  01/08/16
Alternate:  5 Days in the Waukesha County Jail
Filed by defendant regarding sentence credit.
